content: photo of horse bookend section horse bookend motif overlay mosaic crochet compatible with zigzcrochet s mosaic bookcase pattern includes - left facing horse bookend chart - right facing horse bookend chart - left handed and right handed written instructions for both charts - english - us terminology izzy and frog horse bookend motif page 1/10 pattern contents pattern notes 2 general overlay mosaic instructions 2 chart 1 - horse facing left right handed 3 written pattern for chart 1 - horse facing left 4 right handed chart 2 - horse facing right right handed 5 written pattern for chart 2 - horse facing right 6 right handed chart 3 - horse facing left left handed 7 written pattern for chart 3 - horse facing left 8 left handed chart 4 - horse facing right left handed 9 written pattern for chart 4 - horse facing right 10 left handed pattern notes although this pattern could be completed as a standalone it has been designed to be compatible with zigzcrochet s mosaic bookcase extended https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/mosaic-bookcase-extended this pattern uses us terms the following stitches and techniques are used - chain - single_crochet - double_crochet - angled double_crochet to the left and to the right - double_crochet 2 together - working in the front loop only - working in the back loop only size and gauge the sample on page 1 was made using drops cotton merino dk in dark green and off white hook size 4mm sample size 19x14cm sample gauge 10x10cm = 22sts x 22 row general overlay mosaic instructions the following guides explain how to work overlay mosaic crochet with all of the stitches included in this pattern a beginner s guide to mosaic crochet by sixel designs https //www sixeldesign com/post-1/a-beginner-s-guide-to-mosaic-crochet mosaic overlay crochet angle double_crochet and angle dc2 decrease by carolannecreates https //youtu be/qzozeqyjtoy i zzy and frog horse bookend motif page 2/10 chart 1 - horse facing left right handed key single_crochet blo single_crochet in back loop only worked into stitch of the opposite colour in row below x x double_crochet flo double_crochet in front loop only worked into stitch of the same colour two row below right-angled double_crochet in front loop only \ \ rdc flo worked into stitch of the same colour to the right two row below left-angled double_crochet in front loop only / / ldc flo worked into stitch of the same colour to the left two row below double_crochet 2 together in front loop only double_crochet-ldc-2tog /x the right side is a double_crochet worked into the stitch of the same colour two row below flo the left side is a ldc worked into the stitch of the same colour to the left two row below 0 chain chain row 0 is only necessary if this chart makes up part of your bottom shelf notes - column 41 should only be worked if this chart is the last leftmost chart on your shelf - the unnumbered columns marked a and
